title: Data analysis steps
text:
This web site contains helpful information about processing the Geoscape G-NAF data set. This is a spatial data set containing 15 million physical addresses. This is an open data set that is used to: - help emergency services locate building access points - validate addresses for online forms - infrastructure and land use planning.
Click on this link for more information about the data set can be found here.
Given the complexity of the G-NAF data, it can be tricky figuring out how to manipulate it. So this repository contains some worked examples using open source applications such as R.

title: Data analysis steps
text:
Key steps

Step 1 (Import the data)
Download the data set, which is named Aug 23 - Geoscape G-NAF - GDA2020. Unzip and place in an R project file.
Save in an R project data folder.
Write a script to import the data, for example:

# Objective: import GNAF address data
# Author: Grant Coble-Neal
# Dependencies: nil

library(here)

here() starts at C:/Users/COBLENG/Documents/R/AddressData

library(tidyverse)

── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.3     ✔ readr     2.1.4
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.0
✔ ggplot2   3.4.4     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.0
✔ purrr     1.0.2     


── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors

df.0 <- read.table(here("data", "G-NAF", "G-NAF AUGUST 2023", "Standard", "ACT_ADDRESS_ALIAS_psv.psv"), sep = "|", header = TRUE, stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
head(df)

                                              
1 function (x, df1, df2, ncp, log = FALSE)    
2 {                                           
3     if (missing(ncp))                       
4         .Call(C_df, x, df1, df2, log)       
5     else .Call(C_dnf, x, df1, df2, ncp, log)
6 }

title: About
text:
This web site contains information about the Australian Geoscape Geocoded National Address File (G-NAF).

Attributions
Home address icons created by Andrean Prabowo - Flaticon


  


Thanks for checking out my web site!
